titleStmt.title: E. M. Garriott et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6231

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Governor
Thos E. Bramlett;

The undersigned citizens of Trimble Co Ky. would respectfully represent that John Wright, a young man of sober industrious habits was this day fined bu fifty dollars for carrying concealed a deadly weapon upon confession before us as the Jury who were sworn to try the cause ^tried before J. W. Stewart a Justice of the Peace^ and from the known character of the young man, and considering the condition of the country, wherein every man's life is more or less in danger, as well as his prosperity, we would earnestly entreat your Excellency to remit the sd fine.

E M Garriott
J. P. Strother
F E. Skidmore
John G. Martin
W. P. Maddox
W. H. Harrison
John J. Connell
J. Y. Newkirk
L. Milner
Charles Pennright
W. W. Daily
William Wood
John Y. Shepherd
J. D. F Jones
J R Chandler
W. B. Gillis
G F Giddens
David Gilham
J. S. Stubbins } Jurrymen
The other jurymen said they would sign the petition but they were not all in town when the petition was written

J P Strother
D. S. Lane

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
John Wright
concealed Weapons
$50 --
